justification: “Participants in these studies completed a version of the Judgment Bias Task (JBT; Axt, Nguyen & Nosek, 2018), which is designed to measure discrimination in social judgment.”

“Participants completed a First-Person Shooter Task (FPST; Correll, Park, Judd & Wittenbrink., 2002)… Typical results find that participants exhibit a racial bias in judgment, with a lower criterion to give a ‘shoot’ response for Black versus White targets.”
“Participants in Study 1a completed a seven-block Implicit Association Test (IAT; Greenwald, McGhee & Schwartz, 1998) assessing implicit evaluations of more versus less physically attractive people.”
“Participants in Study 1b completed an IAT measuring implicit identification with Democrats and Republicans.”

“Participants also completed a four-block Brief Implicit Association Test (BIAT; Sriram & Greenwald, 2009) measuring associations between White and Black people with the concepts of danger versus safety.”
“Participants also completed the 12-item Faith in Intuition scale (Epstein, Pacini, Denes-Raj, & Heier, 1996; α = .82, sample item: ‘I trust my initial feelings about people’).”
“and the 18-item Need for Cognition scale (Cacioppo, Petty & Kao, 1984; α = .88, sample item: ‘I find satisfaction in deliberating hard and for long hours’).”

measured_by: Internal Motivation to Respond Without Prejudice scale (IMS)
justification: “Participants also completed the five-item Internal Motivation to Respond Without Prejudice scale (IMS; Plant & Devine, 1998), adapted to be about treatment of less physically attractive people.”
construct: Internal motivation to respond without prejudice
